interestingFact: Japan is home to the world’s oldest company, Kongo Gumi, founded in 578 AD.
Brazil has the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world's oxygen.
Egypt is home to the Great Pyramid of Giza, the last of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Australia is the only continent covered by a single country.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world combined.
India is the world’s largest democracy with over 900 million eligible voters.
Iceland runs almost entirely on renewable energy, mainly geothermal and hydroelectric power.
South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein.
Chocolate was first made by the ancient Mesoamericans in Mexico.
Switzerland is famous for never taking sides in wars; it has been neutral since 1815.
